question: 泣き虫
sourceMnemonic: You've seen that <ja>泣く</ja> is to cry, so you can probably guess that <ja>泣き</ja> is just "cry." You've also seen how <ja>虫</ja> is rarely a nice thing to call someone. So what's a mean thing you can call someone who cries? How about a <vocabulary>crybaby</vocabulary>?
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings come from <ja>泣く</ja> and <ja>虫</ja>. So long as you're okay with those two words you should be able to read this one too.
